sen.j: この義家の武勇譚は、『保元物語』で源為朝の弓の腕前を語る際に引き合いに出されるなど、著名な話であったと思われるが、これも『今昔』の好むところではなかったらしい。
sen.e: This tale of Yoshiie's gest is very well known as seen in the fact that it is referred to when talking about MINAMOTO no Tametomo's skill in shooting with a bow in "Hogen Monogatari", but is seems that "Konjaku" did not like it.

This tale of Yoshiie's gesture is very well known, as seen in the fact that it's referred to when talking about MINAMOTO no Tametomo's skill as an archer in "Hogen Monogatari"; however, it seems that "Konjaku" didn't like it.

This story of Yoshiie's prowess is thought to have been well known, as demonstrated by reference to the event in a depiction of MINAMOTO no Tametomo's archery skill in "Hogen Monogatari," but it appears that the author of "Konjaku" deemed it unsuitable for this work.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。コンマの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: また、『陸奥話記』は物語の最後に、頼義の功績を漢の高祖の中国平定や、坂上田村麻呂に譬えるなど賞賛の言を惜しまないが、『今昔』はこれもカットしている。
sen.e: Also, in "Mutsuwaki", Yoriyoshi was admired by reducing Yoriyoshi's merits with that of subjugation of whole country by Gaozu of Han and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro in the last part of the story, but "Konjaku" omitted also this.

Also, in "Mutsuwaki," Yoriyoshi was portrayed with admiration by reducing Yoriyoshi's merits with that of subjugation of the whole country by Gaozu of Han and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro in the last part of the story, but "Konjaku" omitted this as well.

At the end of the story, "Mutsuwa-ki" praises Yoriyoshi's achievements by likening them to both Gaozu's subjugation of Han Dynasty China and to SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro but these references are also omitted from "Konjaku."
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: また、問題となる変更点としては、頼義が平永衡を殺害するいきさつがあげられる。
sen.e: As a problematic modification, we can point out the reason why Yoriyoshi killed TAIRA no Nagahira.
As a problematic modification, we can point out the reason that Yoriyoshi killed TAIRA no Nagahira.
Problematic changes include the sequence of events leading to Yoriyoshi's killing of TAIRA no Nagahira.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 永衡は経清とともに頼時の婿であったが、頼義に味方する。
sen.e: Nagahira was a son-in-law of Yoritoki, same as Tsunekiyo, but he took Yoriyoshi's side.
Nagahira was a son-in-law of Yoritoki, like Tsunekiyo, but he took Yoriyoshi's side.
Like Tsunekiyo, Nagahira was a son-in-law of Yoritoki but sided with Yoriyoshi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、裏切りを疑われて頼義に殺される。
sen.e: But, he was suspected betrayal and killed by Yoriyoshi.
However, he was suspected of betrayal and was killed by Yoriyoshi.
However, he was suspected of betrayal and killed by Yoriyoshi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: この箇所、『陸奥話記』では永衡を「不忠不義者」で「謀略所出」であるとする。
sen.e: In "Mutsuwaki," however, this portion pointed out that Nagahira was "disloyal and ungrateful" and "made a plot."

sen.e: In "Mutsuwaki," however, this portion pointed out that Nagahira was "disloyal and ungrateful" and that he had "conceived a plot."
"Mutsuwa-ki" states in its account of this event that Nagahira was 'disloyal and immoral' and that he had 'conceived a plot.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 彼が銀の兜をかぶっているのは、黄巾の乱での黄色い頭巾とおなじで、誤って撃たれないためのものであると書かれている。
sen.e: It is written that the reason why he wore a silver helmet is to prevent to get shot erroneously, same as yellow turban in the Yellow Turban Rebellion. the

sen.e: It is written that the reason he wore a silver helmet was to prevent being shot erroneously, as was the case with the yellow turban in the Yellow Turban Rebellion.
It is written that he wore a silver helmet in order to, like the Yellow Turbans of the Yellow Turban Rebellion, avoid being accidently attacked by his allies.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 一方、『今昔』ではある人が頼義に永衡の裏切りを密告するだけで、兜がほかと違う、という以外は一切の証拠はあげられていない。
sen.e: On the other hand, in "Konjaku", only a certain person informs Yoriyoshi of Nagahira's betrayal and no evidence is shown other than that the helmet is different from others.
On the other hand, in "Konjaku," only a certain person informs Yoriyoshi of Nagahira's betrayal and no evidence is shown other than that the helmet is different from others.

On the other hand, "Konjaku" simply states that somebody secretly informs Yoriyoshi of Nagahira's betrayal and, other than saying that his helmet is different from those of others, gives absolutely no other evidence.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 見方によっては、永衡に反逆の意図があったかどうかは（事実は不明だが、物語の文脈としては）不明であって、頼義の猜疑心が永衡を討たせたともいえる。
sen.e: In certain view, it is not sure if Nagahira had intention to betray (although the fact is not known, but as the context of the story), Yoriyoshi's suspicion killed Nagahira.
From a certain perspective it isn't certain whether Nagahira intended betrayal (the fact isn't known, so this is simply in the context of the story), but Yoriyoshi's suspicion killed Nagahira.

Depending on the viewpoint, it is uncertain whether or not Nagahira intended to betray Yoriyoshi (the facts are unknown but judging from the context of the story), but it can be said that Nagahira's death was caused by Yoriyoshi's suspicion.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 上の例と合わせて、『陸奥話記』よりも、『今昔』は頼義・義家親子への共感にとぼしいといえる。
sen.e: Together with the example above, we can say that, compared to "Mutsuwaki", "Konjaku" showed less sympathy to the father and son, Yoriyoshi and Yoshiie.
Together with the example above, we can say that "Konjaku," by comparison to "Mutsuwaki," showed less sympathy to the father and son, Yoriyoshi and Yoshiie.
From the examples given above, it can be said that "Konjaku" shows less sympathy to the father and son Yoriyoshi and Yoshiie than "Mutsuwa-ki" does.

sen.j: このほか、『陸奥話記』を典拠とする話は、『扶桑略記』『十訓抄』などにもみえる。
